attributes.action: Remove VAT on female sanitary wear.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Value Added Tax (VAT) is levied on 'luxury' items. VAT is chargeable at a reduced rate of 5% on eligible sanitary protection products. This reduced rate came into effect on 1 January 2001. (HMRC Reference:Notice 701/18 (March 2002))

 Any woman will tell you that these items are NOT luxury items but a necessity for us during menstruation. Why should we be taxed on a product that we HAVE to use every month for maybe 45 years of our life? I therefore propose that the Government removes ALL VAT on sanitary wear.

rejection.details: Under European rules once VAT has been levied on a product it can never be removed, but it can be reduced to the minimum rate of 5%
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
